faq.question: Which Claude models work with these examples?
faq.answer: Examples use claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022. Newer models like Haiku 4.5 are also supported. Check docs.anthropic.com for current model list.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Examples are in Python but concepts apply to any language with Anthropic SDK. Official SDKs exist for Python, TypeScript, and Go.

faq.question: How do I run the code examples?
faq.answer: Install the Anthropic Python SDK with pip install anthropic. Set ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable. Copy examples to your project.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these examples?
faq.answer: Examples run client-side with your API key. No data is sent to third parties beyond Anthropic API. API calls follow Anthropic privacy policy.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limit errors?
faq.answer: Implement exponential backoff retry logic. Use Haiku model for higher rate limits. Consider prompt caching to reduce request volume.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude documentation?
faq.answer: Cookbooks provide production-ready code examples beyond basic API reference. They include complete patterns, integrations, and real-world use cases.
